intro: Ocotea myriantha, commonly known as the fragrant ocotea, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels and cinnamon trees, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The leaves are typically elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a distinct aromatic scent when crushed. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by dark blue, berry-like fruits. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within tropical rainforests.
